coref: An Ass was feeding in a pasture near a wood when An Ass saw a Wolf lurking in the shadows along the hedge. An Ass easily guessed what a Wolf a Wolf had in mind, and thought of a plan to save An Ass. So An Ass pretended An Ass was lame, and began to hobble painfully. When a Wolf a Wolf came up, a Wolf asked An Ass An Ass what had made An Ass lame, and An Ass An Ass replied that An Ass had stepped on a sharp thorn. Please pull he had stepped on a sharp thorn out, An Ass pleaded, groaning as if in pain. If you do not, he had stepped on a sharp thorn might stick in your throat when you eat me. a Wolf a Wolf saw the wisdom of the advice, for a Wolf wanted to enjoy a Wolf meal without any danger of choking. So An Ass An Ass lifted up An Ass foot and a Wolf a Wolf began to search very closely and carefully for a sharp thorn. Just then An Ass An Ass kicked out with all An Ass might, tumbling a Wolf a Wolf a dozen paces away. And while a Wolf a Wolf was getting very slowly and painfully to a Wolf feet, An Ass galloped away in safety. Serves me right, growled a Wolf a Wolf as a Wolf crept into the bushes. I'm a butcher by trade, not a doctor.
